intro: Chlorophytum kirkii, commonly known as the African lily, is a species of flowering plant in the Asparagaceae family. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are often variegated with white or yellow markings. The plant produces tall, slender flower stalks that bear small, white or pale blue flowers. It is a hardy, drought-tolerant plant that thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Chlorophytum kirkii is popular as a houseplant due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
